reviewText: great movie if u like talin dog movies one the best out therei deff recommend u to buy this movie is tottally worh it

This is a good family film.  The dogs are amazing!  How on earth did they ever teach them to talk?  And play classical piano?  There were so many different breeds and the little outfits were so cute.  The chihuahua family and their human family are living and working at a prestigious canine hotel where they have other doggie friends and many adventures.  I liked that the parents were not portrayed as bumbling idiots as they so often are.

Overall, I think this is the best of the 3 Chihuahua films.

This in my opinion, is the best of the movies.  The whold family was highly supportive of it and they do not want to stop watching it.  My 9 year old grand daughter sat in front of our Big Screen TV watching it until she finally collapsed into a deep sleep at around 11:30 p.m.  Congrats on a great entertainment value.
sweet, charming, excellent family movie!!  didn't really see the first two, but it didn't make a difference.  this movie stands on it's own.

This is for sure a Disney classic, because this movie has everything a great disney classic needs, great characters, great/funny/sarcastic  villians, and a great catchy song sung by rainia Rodriguez. The story was great the chihuahua animation was awesome really cool, good story and always kept everyone interested in the movie.

I highly reccommend if looking for a good family film!

This charming film is delightful from the first bark to the last peanut butter pit!  If you haven't seen the film and don't know what I'm talking about, let's just say that dogs and peanut butter is a more unbeatable combination than peanut butter and chocolate.  George Lopez and the rest of the voice actors give real heart and soul to all the darling dogs, even the ones with bit (or bite sized) parts. And of course, Papi rules!  This is Disney at its finest:  whimsy, fun, beautiful production value and great animated magic that takes you to a happy, light-hearted place which is sometimes just what the doctor ordered during these  stressful, difficult times.  I felt like I was on  a wonderful fantasy vacation with my lovely dog friends at the very posh Langham Pasadena.  Not only five star accommodations, but a five star film all the way! The talking animal effects are the most effective to date and helped pull me into their idyllic, happy world.  Felt as rested as if I went on a spa date.  Have fun and keep that silly grin on your face! It's Disney baby. Oh, and don't rent this one. Buy it!  It will keep the kids quiet and happy for hours as they rewatch all  the cute talking puppies, and you'll want to visit again with the  Shakespearean chorus of mariachi chihuahuas. Yep, you heard that right!

This movie was totally funny!

I'm a big-time fan of the original BHChichuahua, but I found part 2 lacking and forgettable. Part 3 is way better, almost as good as the original in terms of laughs, thanks in large part to newcomer scriptwriter Dana Starfield. There were certain music scenes that had me literally rolling on the floor with laughter, and a certain happy ending that appears halfway through the closing credits that had me in tears.

I feel like a lot of effort was put into this sequal; I highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys the original.

Disney sent this third installment straight to DVD probably realizing it wouldn't grab big box office numbers.  However, the series is popular with kids and you can see why---cute dogs, cute dogs and more cute dogs.  There's the necessary family values, bumbling villains, and prospects of doom avoided by eleventh hour heroics by the dogs.  It's all harmless fun and one can't help getting into the festivities.  The voice casting led by George Lopez and Odette Annable does well and the humans gracefully play second fiddle to the canine stars.
Is BHC3 great film-making?  No---but its good family viewing.  A 4th entry is probably right around the corner.

Papi, the main doggie, is going to party to celebrate friends and family. He and his canine friends move into a posh Beverly Hills hotel.  But Rosa, littlest member, feels less special.  Papi helps her find strength, more than she expected.  Funny, loving, exciting for the whole family. Cute movie

BEVERLY HILLS CHIHUAHUA 3 is defintely a movie for young kids. Adults without kids may find this movie too silly to be enjoyable yet BEVERLY HILLS CHIHUAHUA 3 is full of charm and some humor for kids of all ages. Papi and Chloe are back with the kids and their "humans" have gotten a job in a very posh Beverly Hills hotel that caters to both humans and dogs.
BEVERLY HILLS CHIHUAHUA 3 is good natured and fun. It does go overboard in camp with dogs in costumes acting and talking like humans. Of course, that is the charm of the film. There is also a good lesson here for kids about accepting others who are different. The lesson centers around little Rosa, who is the runt of her parents' litter. She is small in size but huge in heart and dedication and will prove that dogs of all sizes are equals.
This would be a fun movie to watch with young kids. I imagine the joy and wonder they would experience watching dogs dressing and acting like humans. It is less appealing for adults alone but I had my share of chuckles. Certainly, the scene of Chloe doing a piano recital (and a darn fantastic one) in front of an audience was priceless--that scene alone was worth watching.
Although this movie was direct to video, the quality is A+ and it seems like BEVERLY HILLS CHIHUAHUA 3 should have been a theatrical movie. Families are eager to find cute movies for their kids to see in theaters.
BEVERLY HILLS CHIHUAHUA 3 is the perfect movie for kids and for families with young kids. This is a great movie for adults to enjoy with their young kids on family night.
